job description:
POSITION MISSION: Data Analyst will work with the Analytics and R&D departments to assist our team of developers and risk adjustment experts in analyzing and validating large, diverse datasets contributing to internal and external initiatives. The candidate will be working closely with senior and C-level decision makers, and collaborating with a cross-functional team of industry-leading individuals in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial-oriented environment.

JOB FUNCTIONS:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for a number of functions including, but not limited to:
  • Using SQL or other appropriate tools to validate and analyze datasets; developing reports and analyses
  • Providing quality assurance and insights of imported data, supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization
  • Providing technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing
  • Researching and identifying issues to determine source of discrepancies; providing recommendations for error resolution
  • Consistently evaluating and tracking algorithm quality
  • Guiding stakeholders and end-users on devising effective and efficient approaches to achieving superior data quality
  • Other duties as assigned
Skills, Knowledge, Abilities:
  • Strong proficiency in SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) a must
  • Proven ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure
  • Deep analytical capabilities
  • Excellent documentation, organizational, and problem solving abilities required
  • High degree of professionalism, enthusiasm, autonomy and initiative on a daily basis
  • Self-driving and leadership
  • Ability to work within a team environment
  • Excellent listening, interpersonal, written and oral communication skills
  • Experience interfacing with both external and internal customers at all levels
  • Demonstrated ability to analyze problems and understand the necessary components of a solution through analysis, planning, evaluation of cost/benefit, testing and reporting
Training/Education:
  • Bachelors degree in related field of study is required
  • Advanced degree in related field of study is preferred
Experience:
  • Experience in health care insurance or health care is preferred, but those with relevant experience in other industries may be considered
  • Experience in methodologies and processes for managing large scale databases; working with large, diverse datasets from multiple sources
  • Experience in Agile methodology a plus
